lead_paragraph: Berkshire Hathaway said on Friday that it had agreed to buy The Waco Tribune-Herald to expand in Texas. Berkshire is buying the newspaper, which has a daily circulation of 34,000, from the Robinson family, the company said. Terms were not disclosed. Warren E. Buffett, Berkshire’s chief, has said that newspapers must rethink whether to offer free content on the Internet, and that publications with a community focus can thrive where there is little competition.

headline.main: Berkshire Hathaway Buys a Newspaper in Texas
